channel.title: Exams on Wheatinfo
channel.description: Recent content in Exams on Wheatinfo

item.title: Comprehensive literature
item.description: New genetic resources for aphid resistance were identified from a newly developed wheat mutant library Genome-wide identification and comprehensive analysis of the phytochrome-interacting factor (PIF) gene family in wheat Chemical-tag-based semi-annotated metabolomics facilitates gene identification and specialized metabolic pathway elucidation in wheat Wheat Transcriptional Corepressor TaTPR1 Suppresses Susceptibility Genes TaDND1/2 and Potentiates Post-Penetration Resistance against Blumeria graminis forma specialis tritici Enzymatic Preparation and Processing Properties of DPP-IV Inhibitory Peptides Derived from Wheat Gluten: Effects of Pretreatment Methods and Protease Types Genome-wide association study of agronomic traits related to nitrogen use efficiency in Henan wheat Effects of Wheat Oligopeptide on the Baking and Retrogradation Properties of Bread Rolls: Evaluation of Crumb Hardness, Moisture Content, and Starch Crystallization Genome-wide identification, gene expression and haplotype analysis of the rhomboid-like gene family in wheat (Triticum aestivum L.

item.title: Cultivation and Planting of Wheat
item.description: Modulations of wheat growth by selenium nanoparticles under salinity stress Interactive effects of a stimbiotic supplementation and wheat bran inclusion in corn- or wheat-based diets on growth performance, ileal digestibility, and expression of nutrient transporters of broilers chickens Completing the picture of field-grown cereal crops: a new method for detailed leaf surface models in wheat Diversity of chemical composition and nutritional value in grain from selected winter wheat cultivars grown in south-western Poland Wheat fungal endophyte communities are inseparable from the host and influence plant development Combined effect of endophytic Bacillus mycoides and rock phosphate on the amelioration of heavy metal stress in wheat plants Effects of agro based organic amendments on growth and cadmium uptake in wheat and rice crops irrigated with raw city effluents: Three years field study Protecting spring wheat plants using selenium and pesticides Exploring the genotype-environment interaction of bread wheat in ambient and high-temperature planting conditions: a rigorous investigation Phosphate-Solubilizing Bacillus sp.

item.title: Nutrition and Health of Wheat
item.description: Dynamic metabolite QTL analyses provide novel biochemical insights into kernel development and nutritional quality improvement in common wheat Improvement of soil health and nutrient transformations under balanced fertilization with integrated nutrient management in a rice-wheat system in Indo-Gangetic Plains - A 34-year Research outcomes Diversity of chemical composition and nutritional value in grain from selected winter wheat cultivars grown in south-western Poland Lutein esterification increases carotenoid retention in durum wheat grain.

item.title: Prevention and Control of Wheat Diseases and Pests
item.description: Appropriate reduction of importin-α gene expression enhances yellow dwarf disease resistance in common wheat Protecting spring wheat plants using selenium and pesticides A possible unexpected link: Could wheat elimination trigger food protein-induced enterocolitis syndrome in a celiac disease patient?

item.title: Processing and utilization of wheat
item.description: Enzymatic Preparation and Processing Properties of DPP-IV Inhibitory Peptides Derived from Wheat Gluten: Effects of Pretreatment Methods and Protease Types Mold Fungal Resistance of Loose-Fill Thermal Insulation Materials Based on Processed Wheat Straw, Corn Stalk and Reed Data on the characterization of seaweed, wheat bran, and other food processing byproducts as feasible biosorbents Processing of hemicellulose in wheat straw by steaming and ultrafiltration - A novel approach Potential nutritional strategies to prevent and reverse sarcopenia in aging process: Role of fish oil-derived ω-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids, wheat oligopeptide and their combined intervention Maiorca wheat malt: A comprehensive analysis of physicochemical properties, volatile compounds, and sensory evaluation in brewing process and final product quality Interconnectable 3D-printed sample processing modules for portable mycotoxin screening of intact wheat Nano fertilizer synergist effects on nitrogen utilization and related gene expression in wheat No-tillage with straw mulching promotes the utilization of soil nitrogen by rice under wheat-rice and oilseed rape-rice cropping systems Utilization of a publicly available diversity panel in genomic prediction of Fusarium head blight resistance traits in wheat The effect of different wheat varieties and exogenous xylanase on bird performance and utilization of energy and nutrients Impact of food processing on the allergenic properties of amylase trypsin inhibitors from wheat Isolation, characterization, and utilization of wheat bran protein fraction for food application Low Allergenicity in Processed Wheat Flour Products Using Tannins from Agri-Food Wastes Wheat GSPs and Processing Quality Are Affected by Irrigation and Nitrogen through Nitrogen Remobilisation Farmer vs.

item.title: Varieties and Genetic Breeding of Wheat
item.description: Lutein esterification increases carotenoid retention in durum wheat grain. A step further in breeding and improving the commercial and nutritional quality during grain storage Molecular Markers Help with Breeding for Agronomic Traits of Spring Wheat in Kazakhstan and Siberia Dissection of a novel major stable QTL on chromosome 7D for grain hardness and its breeding value estimation in bread wheat Breeding for durable resistance against biotrophic fungal pathogens using transgenes from wheat Characterization and identification of the powdery mildew resistance gene in wheat breeding line ShiCG15-009 Discovering Loci for Breeding Prospective and Phenology in Wheat Mediterranean Landraces by Environmental and eigenGWAS Characterization of Pre-Breeding Wheat (Triticum aestivum L.
